channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 当中国银行家的日子不好过。中国共产党希望他们放弃 "享乐主义 "的生活方式，更加爱国。在我们的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @DSORennie 将解释这场新的意识形态运动背后的真正原因： 🎧
item.description:
It’s a bad time to be a Chinese banker. The Communist Party wants them to abandon “hedonistic” lifestyles and be more patriotic.

On our “Drum Tower” podcast, @aliceysu and @DSORennie explain what’s really behind this new ideological campaign: https://t.co/dHn0dDzocj 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 石油供应冲击与 50 年前不同。这是因为美国现在拥有大量石油，而且全球能源市场更加强劲👇。
item.description:
Oil supply shocks are not like they were 50 years ago. That’s because America has a lot of oil now, and the global energy market is more robust https://t.co/VgYRQEdTh7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 技术既是隐性知识传承的答案，也是其障碍。现在比以往任何时候都更容易记录和传播前人的智慧，但这并不总是好事👇。
item.description:
Technology is both an answer and a barrier to the transfer of tacit knowledge. It is easier than ever to record and disseminate the wisdom of older hands—this isn’t always good thing https://t.co/uZcJ7ajd5m 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: "我的社交生活变成了一张评估风险回报的资产负债表--你永远不知道什么时候会坐在餐厅扬声器的下面。
item.description:
“My social life became a balance-sheet of risk-reward assessments—you never know when you might be seated under a speaker in a restaurant.”

Sarah Watling explains what it’s like to live with inescapable, ever-present noise https://t.co/YEdUzAgvj2

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 如今，只有两家制药公司从减肥新药大片中获得了丰厚的回报。但假以时日，随着市场竞争的加剧，受益最大的将是消费者👇。
item.description:
Today only two pharma firms are reaping the rewards from new blockbuster weight-loss drugs. But in time—and with a more competitive market— it will be consumers who benefit most https://t.co/J1DHRky0Vb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 印度人不再需要居住在孟买、德里或班加罗尔这样的一线城市才能成为富翁。印度不断改善的物质基础设施正在更广泛地传播财富👇。
item.description:
Indians no longer need to live in top-tier cities like Mumbai, Delhi or Bangalore to become loaded. The country’s improving physical infrastructure is spreading wealth more widely https://t.co/OlFSPyY3io 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报"：俄罗斯炮击哈尔科夫、美国首家镍钴精炼厂以及有趣的小说。收听每日播客： 👇
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”: Russian shelling in Kharkiv, America’s first nickel-cobalt refinery, and funny novels. Listen to the daily podcast: https://t.co/MPBPGJsmVj 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: TikTok 与中国有联系确实令人担忧，中国政府视媒体为宣传工具，与西方意识形态冲突严重。
item.description:
It is a real concern that TikTok has links to China, whose government sees the media as a tool of propaganda and which is in deep ideological conflict with the West https://t.co/hB58y7alxp

Photo: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/UGx4us3k0s

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 试图使英格兰历史建筑现代化的努力正在制造令人头疼的官僚主义问题。现在是更新建筑保护程序的时候了吗？ 👇
item.description:
Efforts to try and modernise England’s historic buildings are creating bureaucratic headaches. Is it time to update the process for protecting architecture? https://t.co/bQzoAIo39t 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 奥拉夫-肖尔茨一直在抵制向乌克兰提供金牛座巡航导弹的国内和国际压力。我们将解释这些导弹是什么--以及为什么德国总理没有屈服的迹象👇。
item.description:
Olaf Scholz has resisted domestic and international pressure to supply Ukraine with Taurus cruise missiles. We explain what these are—and why Germany’s chancellor shows no sign of buckling https://t.co/elS4nQ27dD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 现在是政府对新媒体采用与旧媒体相同的逻辑的时候了。如果说，TikTok 等新平台需要更多警惕，因为它们的输出是如此不透明👇。
item.description:
It is time for governments to apply the same logic to new media as they do to old. If anything, new platforms such as TikTok require greater vigilance, since their output is so opaque https://t.co/FAVKizxpir 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 石油工业从未如此庞大，但气候变化的灾难性危害却显而易见。现在是进行根本变革的时候了👇。
item.description:
The oil industry has never been bigger, yet the disastrous hazards of climate change are manifest.

It is time for a fundamental change https://t.co/g4R3iLvp3b 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 在美国高中，毕业率上升了，但标准却下降了。人们认为，降低学术标准有助于缩小成绩差距。然而，这可能会产生相反的效果 👇。
item.description:
In American high schools, graduation rates are up but standards are down. Lowering the academic bar, it is thought, can help narrow achievement gaps. Yet it may have the opposite effect https://t.co/Rafv5BcHlv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 自 1974 年以来，葡萄牙一直是民主过渡和稳定的典范。现在，葡萄牙正面临着一段政治动荡期，因为在一次选举之后，没有任何政党有明确的执政道路👇。
item.description:
Portugal has mostly been a model of democratic transition and stability since 1974. Now it is facing a period of political turmoil, after an election has left no party a clear path to govern https://t.co/3zrm3IwTcT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 阿司匹林生产商需要的不仅仅是止痛药。自从完成对美国农用化学品巨头孟山都公司的收购以来，它的股东价值已经损失了 70%。如果该公司要恢复元气，就必须消除这笔交易留下的毒害👇。
item.description:
The Aspirin-maker needs more than a painkiller. It has torched 70% in shareholder value since it completed the acquisition of Monsanto, an American agrochemical giant. If the company is to recover it must undo that deal’s toxic legacy https://t.co/WH2bWZ8a4A 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: "大卫-伊诺克（David Enoch）在为《经济学人》撰写的客座文章中指出："[以色列]目前军事行动的主要剩余目标是本雅明-内塔尼亚胡（Binyamin Netanyahu）的政治生存。他认为这场战争 "不应再得到支持"。
item.description:
“The main remaining aim of [Israel’s] military operation as it is currently run is the political survival of Binyamin Netanyahu,” argues David Enoch in a guest essay for The Economist.

He believes the war “should no longer be supported” https://t.co/ezyMFAoUIh

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯为期三天的投票活动并不是西方世界大多数人所理解的选举。在这片土地上，战争就是和平，无知就是力量，自由就是奴役，其本质就是没有选择👇。
item.description:
Russia’s three-day voting exercise is not an election in the way most people in the Western world understand one. In a land where war is peace, ignorance is strength and freedom is slavery, its essence is the absence of choice https://t.co/Kv3ikJDcqD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 肥胖薪酬差距比以前想象的还要严重。这种差距对男性和女性都有影响，而且受过良好教育的人的差距更大。
item.description:
The obesity pay gap is worse than previously thought. It affects men as well as women, and is wider for the well-educated https://t.co/kbNMXD5Kzc

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 英国最有名的小报正在软化。那些担心文化右翼势力发展的人可以从中吸取两个教训
item.description:
Britain’s most famous tabloid newspaper is softening. Those who fret about the advance of the cultural right can take two lessons from this https://t.co/8Lh6Si6iOW pic.twitter.com/QUcMDOt5dN

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 民主统一党和新芬党都有充分的理由不再次推翻斯托蒙特。但北爱尔兰新政府面临的任务是艰巨的👇。
item.description:
Both the Democratic Unionist Party and Sinn Féin have very good reasons not to topple Stormont again. But the task ahead for Northern Ireland’s new government is hard https://t.co/tvQL6S5PDz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 摄入更少的卡路里可以防止衰老 👇
item.description:
Eating fewer calories can ward off ageing https://t.co/6mtItREABb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 多发性硬化症会很快成为过去吗？接吻病毒 "疫苗点燃希望 👇
item.description:
Could multiple sclerosis soon be a thing of the past? A vaccine for the “kissing virus” is igniting hope https://t.co/wVblVL26uh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: TikTok 与中国有联系确实令人担忧，中国政府视媒体为宣传工具，与西方意识形态冲突严重。
item.description:
It is a real concern that TikTok has links to China, whose government sees the media as a tool of propaganda and which is in deep ideological conflict with the West https://t.co/ccZB5nZz2t 👇

item.title: 欧洲绿党为何仍不景气
item.description:
Why Europe’s green parties are still not in season https://t.co/7Qbg6VhcrC

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 人力资源部门的 Barry 真的让你忍无可忍，需要发泄一下吗？工作中发脾气的利与弊 👇
item.description:
Has Barry from HR really been pushing your buttons and you need to vent? These are the pros and cons of losing your temper at work https://t.co/cQzwTiibfT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 最新研究显示，全球最便宜的 20 座城市中有 9 座位于亚洲。但亚洲大陆也有一些世界上最昂贵的大都市👇。
item.description:
Nine of the world’s 20 cheapest cities are in Asia, according to new research. But the continent is also home to some of the world’s most exorbitant metropolises https://t.co/ovCJ9DqQWf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 寻找下一本读物？这九本近期出版的历史类图书是该类型图书中的佼佼者👇。
item.description:
Looking for your next read? These nine recent books on history are some of the best the genre has to offer https://t.co/Wbdbcbu8DG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 三本书解释了为什么它很重要--而且很容易丢失 👇
item.description:
Three books explain why it matters—and can easily be lost https://t.co/xbOE4jAYia 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 13, 2024

item.title: 纽约的房价高得惊人。事实上，它是北美最昂贵的城市。看看您的城市排名如何 👇
item.description:
New York is startlingly expensive. In fact, it is the most costly city in North America. Find out where yours ranks https://t.co/Qro4bUeF2f 👇

item.title: 这十张图表比较了乔-拜登和唐纳德-特朗普的记录。谁更胜一筹？ 👇
item.description:
